text: Wakhaf repelled the nomads and secured the borders. He is a peerless master of desert warfare.
Conquering lands beyond the mountains east of Nehekhara, Rakhash was a bringer of great prosperity.
The son of Khetep ruled only briefly before his death, but his grasp of engineering and urban development were legendary.
Lahmizzash continued the fight against Nagash, retaking sacred Khemri with the aid of his potent Ushabti.
Ruling in the wake of the war with Nagash, Setep restored the Necropolis and the Priesthood to their former glory.
This warrior-king was unmatched in chariot tactics. Only the finest crews served under him - and will again, of course…
What? Benign? Compassionate? Empathetic, even? A Skaven? Can it be true? Surely this is a ruse?
The Liche King may have dark sorcery and the power of the Great Necromancer, but that's not always enough when facing massed-ranks and hefty blades.
The Warrior-Queen was defeated once before in life – fatally. Although she was saved by the blessings of the Asp-Goddess then, they cannot save her now.
They say he can hold back death's cold embrace. I see little evidence of that this day!
As it turns out, the Imperishable is just as perishable as the rest of us…
That's not a chariot... *This* is a chariot!
And so a mighty Chaos warlord lies defeated, beyond the help of the Dark Gods he serves.
Turning and running away, under the auspices of coming back with reinforcements, is just running away – and the mark of a coward to boot.
The servants of the Great Horned Rat are entirely blunt instruments – pity, remorse, forgiveness are entirely alien to their nature.
Skaven are not known to be patient – intolerant, implacable, unsparing and ruthless perhaps, but not patient; this one might just be the exception, but then he is playing a much longer game...
Kneel before the might of Settra the Imperishable, Khemrikhara, Lord of the Earth, He Who Holds The Sceptre...

Kneel before the might of Settra the Imperishable, Khemrikhara, Lord of the Earth, He Who Holds The Sceptre, High King of Nehekhara, Ruler of the Four Horizons, Monarch of the Sky, Mighty Lion of the Infinite Desert...

Kneel before the might of Settra the Imperishable, Khemrikhara, Lord of the Earth, He Who Holds The Sceptre, High King of Nehekhara, Ruler of the Four Horizons, Monarch of the Sky, Mighty Lion of the Infinite Desert, The King of Kings, Great Hawk of the Heavens, Majestic Emperor of the Shifting Sands and Eternal Sovereign of Khemri's Legions.
Kneel before the might of Settra the Imperishable...
This one has an array of agents at his disposal, has *all* the cards, and pulls *all* the strings – tread carefully in his presence and beware!
Alarielle's powers recede as the dark tide of Chaos grows stronger and the mortal world cries out in torment.
Chaos flows through the world; mortal beings everywhere suffer and Alarielle grows weaker as Chaos grows ever stronger.
As Alarielle grasps the last remnants of her fleeting power, the mortal world grasps its last shred of hope.
The world is free of Chaos and Alarielle is, for now at least, absolved of her duty to protect the mortal world from torment.
The High Elves will have to find a new title for their beloved queen, as she certainly isn’t around for-‘ever’.
The reign of Anar is at an end; the Shadow King has stepped into the light for the final time.
The trouble with nights of debauchery always comes the day after - not so much ‘hung over’ as ‘hanged’!
The darkness dominates your soul. Only death can release you from its grasp!
It only takes a bit of light flogging and denial of shore leave for a less-than-stellar reputation to develop.
Notoriety can be acquired for a number of reasons, but mostly those of the insalubrious kind.
It could be said that this one's reputation walks before them.
Many an opponent has turned tail and ran when this one raised their colours, and for extremely good reasons!
Once again, the Norscans can raid and rob and plunder in peace. For now, at least.
Back down to Galleon's Graveyard with you, Noctilus, it's all you're good for!
Right, earplugs out, lads - she's gone down to Stromfels' Chest, where she belongs, the harpy!
You'd better make sure you kill him or this will not be the end of the matter - not even close.
Although a deadly foe has been defeated, one has to wonder if all his personalities have been slain…
Luthor’s mind is being controlled by his most craven personality, which would sooner have him cower behind his Undead minions before facing danger directly.
A determinedly vicious and unhinged portion of Luthor’s soul controls this personality, occasionally making him think he is the Kraken itself!
Paranoia, although a sign of madness, doesn't mean they aren't all out to get you and you shouldn’t kill them first.
Luthor’s mind is currently helmed by the personality most saturated with his self-promoting arrogance, only ever satisfied by destroying enemies in the most extravagant ways possible.
His psyche restored, Arch Grand Commodore Luthor Harkon is back to his old, utterly terrifying self.
Many find it hard not to be tempted, though they must sense the danger.
Bring me wine! And gold, slaves - I want more, damn your eyes!
This alliance will hold whilst it remains worth my while... and not a second longer.
The profits speak for themselves. I see no reason to change the arrangement at this time.
Ha, we will scale the heights, beyond the crow's nest even. We will achieve great things - I feel it in my blood!
A legend amongst some communities. It's said that his presence has a profound effect on local development efficiency.
This man is in command of Lokhir Fellheart's Black Ark.
Ikit Claw may have been defeated utterly, but he'll surely be back again soon, with a new, better, nastier, probably-motorised plan. Watch out!
Ha! For all his power, the Prophet couldn't foresee his own demise...
The skies are brighter - and safer - today now the bewinged purveyor of death from above has been taken down.
Markus Wulfhart’s many great deeds have earned him the title of Huntsmarshal – the Emperor’s Captain of Scouts.
Gor-Rok's lone spawning and albino colourings betokened his future – a destiny he has fulfilled through thousands of hard-fought triumphs.
Nakai goes wherever he is needed the most, his presence a tangible portent that a battle of great importance may be imminent.
Not all mountains are immovable – locate its weakness, its faultline, and turn the crack into a yawning chasm.
All journeys must eventually come to an end. This one has been cut short long before reaching its destination, however.
This time, the hunter became the hunted, losing out to an opponent altogether more dogged, dangerous and downright lethal than himself.
As he edges ever closer to the prize, Hertwig's desire also grows stronger.
As long as there is battle and war and wounds, Hertwig's skill in saving lives will always be invaluable.
Accepting such a calling indicates a tremendous strength of character.
Useful, laterally-considered ideas are as natural to Jorek as breathing.
In the annals of engineering – if such a thing exists – Jorek's name and reputation loom large.
Whenever she speaks, Kalara's defining passion is evident from her gleaming eyes.
Favoured by the Goddess of Nature, the forest itself shall be Kalara's armour.
Kalara never slows or tires, hunting her target relentlessly until it is cornered.
In all fairness, and to truly feel the humility and solemnity such occasions require, the one who passes judgement should also swing the axe.
Forgiveness is a beautiful thing without which men struggle to move on with their lives.
At last, someone that Rodrik can trust; he will ever be loyal to the Huntsmarshal.
The past has an unpleasant habit of coming back to bite one…
Hardened by his years of bitter, bloody experience, Rodrik was becoming a loner; now, he's found a new pack with which to run.
It's going to take more than that to finish them off! But perhaps you've made yourself an entry in their chronicles?
Do not shed a tear, for this darkest, most murderous of Druchii may now be with the Cytherai, deep within the Mirai, where he surely belongs!
Bretonnia's blessed cleanser has herself been defeated by the ravening Undead hordes which dare infest the Badlands!
It would appear that the Eshin's infamous Chief Assassin has been decisively defeated, the victim of his own malice.
Grom is hungry! He needs to sample some recipes to begin expanding his portly waistline.
Having had his fill of the appetizers, Grom is well on his way towards sampling the world’s many delicacies.
Grom’s banqueting bonanzas have bestowed him with great width and power, the ladz regard him with increasing awe.
Grom’s legendary feasts have given him a great gut to go with his great power; surely no one can stop him now!
Grom has conquered the culinary world, his great size and notoriety now giving him the impetus to conquer the Warden’s gaudy realm and lands beyond!
With the dour defender defeated, Ulthuan lies exposed.
Minaithnir has been hardened by Shackolot’s poison, learning the ways of the Black Dragon’s noxious breath.
Blessings typically reserved for the Asrai now imbue Imrik with the protection of the forest.
Just as it empowered Lamoureux, the hidden light of the natural moon heightens Imrik’s martial prowess.
Originating from plains of existence known only to Star Dragons, stellar energies have saturated Imrik’s lifeforce.
Gordinar’s resplendent aura has imparted a portion of the Sun Dragon’s immense vitality unto the Dragon Prince.
A Sentinel is resolved to be an immovable force, leading from the front against adversity and mortal dangers that others would flee from.
Dwelling in concealment, a Shadow primes their skills to strike from the darkness and remain unseen, much to the detriment of their enemies.
Watchers dedicate themselves to the masteries of the land, traversing and reconnoitering all environments with the aptitude of the finest rangers.
Looted Bretonnian relics have imbued Drycha and her followers with magical protection.
After rescuing Ceithin-Har from the Beastmen ritual, the Sisters and their mounts are united once more.
The secrets of the world’s fate are now cast into oblivion along with the ancient hunter’s soul.
As it turns out, you don’t always need an immovable object to stop an unstoppable force.
Always had something to complain about, that one.
A blast of Kazador's mighty horn inspires his Dawi allies and sows dismay amongst his enemies.
He who is gifted the means to conquer his own mortality can live forever.
It matters not how slow or fast you go, as long as the killing does not stop.
The Bloodbeast marauds on, crushing all in turn – some sooner, some later, but ultimately none will escape.
With no respite from the rage that consumes him, Taurox shall never tire in his rampages.
Don’t try to run, there’s no way to survive. A vicious surrender, he’ll eat you alive.
There can be no doubt – the Brass Bull will not stop until he is somehow put in the grave once and for all.
Slaughterhorn’s roaring, snorting engine of destruction roars on with death and despair in its wake!
The thick scent of death is carried upon the wind as army after army falls to the Bloodbeast’s relentless stampede!
Even as his warherd lay dead around him, Taurox raged on across the battlefield, killing everything he could find.
The Dark Gods clearly still have use for the Bloodbeast, for he keeps on killing even when all others have been slain.
Tom's schematics are written in cipher to protect their designs! Yes, surely it must be a cipher?
This twin-tailed Skink is unusually gifted in the pursuit and interpretation of ancient lore and often found astride his trusty Troglodon "C'hloe".
Tohm'philli has a reputation for an unbelievably quick tongue, sometimes at the cost of precision!
The disgusting, insidious Children of Chaos must be wiped from the face of the world.
This one hates the autocratic Dragons and their false notions of maintaining 'harmony', desiring to see them wiped from the map altogether.
The Chaos Gods and their unholy servants will pay!
A rage kindled by ember and moulded by hammer boils within this one – the Dawi-Zharr’s dark souls will soon taste their wrath!
Reviled by the Daemon Prince's subservience to the forces of Ruin and Destruction, this one wishes to see all his kind pushed back into the Realm of Chaos where they belong.
Their cruelty is without match, their villainy without end. Don't even get me started on their hair.
The Dwarfs cling to the mountain roots like parasites - this one will purge them!
This one despises the Orcs and their foul kin, as all right-thinking beings should.
They speak of fairness in their high-handed manner, but ultimately it means nothing - if you're not Asur, you're scum.
Men are little more than plague-ridden dogs - put them out of their misery!
Khorne's dishonest masking of His sheer, vicious bloodthirstiness and hatred for its own sake, with a sheen of so-called honour, disgusts this individual.
Kislev, its culture and people serve no useful purpose as far as this one is concerned, so much so that crushing them has become something of an obsession.
Great, big, slimy lizards, doing everything according to their grand 'plan' - they think they're better than us.
Considering the Plague Lord and His vile minions to be nothing more than a blight upon the world, this one thinks a permanent cure should be found as swiftly as possible.
Considering the Ogres and their crude society a pointless accident of creation, this one would see them utterly destroyed.
No one really likes Skaven and if they say otherwise, they're lying. This one, however, hates them with every ounce of their being.
Temptation and depravity threaten to drag all sentient life backwards into savagery, and so must be stopped at all costs, for all time, for the good of civilisation.
The pomp, the circumstance, the colossal egos - and that's quite apart from the decaying flesh and accompanying stench. Very nasty.
Believing, rightly, that Tzeentch and His agents are responsible for all the turmoil, pain and madness in the world, this one would like to see them put down, and out, for good.
Yo ho ho and a bottle of warm blood - as if Vampires could get any worse!
The von Carsteins have crossed us - bring wrath upon their cursed bloodline!
They're disinterested, have overly-long limbs and perfect hair. Add those pointy ears to the mix? Eugh!
Sometimes things just have a way of working out for this one.
Chance looks favourably on this one.
There's being lucky, and then there's being blessed with divine fortune. This one benefits from the latter.
Third time's the charm? Oh… How about the fourth?
Can it really just be bad luck, or does something far more sinister follow this one?
This one's attack might succeed, but if it does it will probably be an accident.
The first step towards a good assault is to face in the direction of the enemy.
A light breeze offers more attacking prowess than this one.
Confidence can take you surprisingly far when assaulting the enemy.
Either through natural skill or the benefit of experience, this one has an admirable ability in taking the fight to their foes.
Even the sturdiest of defences would struggle to withstand this warrior's attack.
That's abject nonsense and you know it!
There is something exhilarating about raising something up from where once there was nothing.
It's not enough to create something beautiful. To truly leave our mark, we must build to last through the ages.
To build something truly awe-inspiring, one must first be inspired to envision a structure worthy of awe.
Such a high body count is bound to make for a bloody reputation.
Death and bloodshed are the pillars of war. Every warrior knows the price of failure.
With both the blood of their allies and the blood of their enemies, this one leaves the battlefield drenched.
Over there! Look! The Moon People are watching us! You see them too, don't you?
Diabolical rat-creatures living right under out feet? Now I've heard it all!
Cut out the foes' hearts and bathe in their blood... It's surprisingly good for the skin…
This one has slain a well-known assassin, raising his status somewhat in the process.
Such unwavering loyalty is rare; it is best to keep this subject close by granting them control over some small fiefdom.
Outstanding personal courage and martial skill are not always enough. Today, the hammer became the anvil.
The Everchosen may rise and rise again, but he will forever be consigned to oblivion!
Heavy is the head that wears the Crown of Sorcery, and probably dead as well!
Behind the golden mask lies the face of ignominious defeat.
The True King lies defeated but will return, spitting oaths and even grumpier than before!
The forest’s most embittered wargrove could not overcome you – the Briarmaven of Woe is felled, her hate-filled spirit erased from the world.
Even the mightiest tree in the forest can be felled - you just need a big enough axe!
At this rate, the Lady of the Lake is going to have to find another representative…
This hide is perhaps not as durable as it originally thought…
This time, the tables have been turned on the last Dawi redoubt, but he'll be back to avenge himself - be certain of that!
Kemmler's quest for the darkest of knowledge will never be over, but has suffered something of a setback.
Apparently death is merely an obstacle to be overcome; must be inconvenient, however.
Stone-cold beauty is no guarantee of victory.
Even great men are flawed; failure is part of mankind's tragic condition.
His single eye will not avail the Lord of Beasts a victory, nor all the fury in his twisted heart.
Roiling skies, raging winds, and lightning didn't help the Herald of the Tempest, laid low this day by honest steel.
Today, the battle is over for Xhotl's last defender, but the war rages on - have no doubt.
It would seem that the lizard king can't always do everything; winning, for instance.
His dreadful staff, and the disease it spreads, cannot save Skrolk from the righteous scourge.
His dreadful staff, and the disease it spreads, cannot save Skrolk from the righteous scourge.
This time, the king might well be dead. Oh well, long live the King!
The Dark King will fall, by blade, by arrow, or by sorcerous power and the darkest magic.
He who quenches his thirst on the blood of the living will find cold steel his just reward.
Her Dark Magic, Daemonic pacts, and evil ways have counted for naught in the face of superior arms.
Faced with an opponent of the right calibre, even the Shadowgave can be bested.
Everyone has a weakness, however well hidden; even immortals must face defeat sometimes.
Pride comes before a fall. Always.
See how he runs - all the way to the sewer from which he first skulked!
Few things are everlasting. Just as dawn signifies the end of night and dusk the end of day, Ariel’s twin maidens are slain!
Sometimes, even the sneakiest among us come unstuck.
With Teclis defeated, who will drive back the forces of Chaos from the world?
What to use to pad my mattress? I know - finest Dwarfbeard!
The blemish of the Unclean one stains the world no more, his foul presence having been wiped from existence.
Now the Asur's greatest warrior has been laid low, what of the island kingdom he is sworn to protect?
Although the Slayer King has been toppled, no doubt he'll be back, bearing the Axe of Dargo and a serious grudge!
Down but probably not out, as you cannot really kill what doesn't truly live.
All the piety in the Old World means nothing when faced with superior military muscle.
When you take a swing at Da Prophet, you smite Gork (and Mork) as well!
An embarrassing defeat is more than enough to bring a tinge of pink to one's cheeks.
This one wears the shame of their many defeats for all to see.
After a certain point, the stench of failure clings so tightly that it can never be washed away.
The only survivor of a meeting with the herd; naturally, the rest all died in screaming agony. It's going to have an effect…
This one has faced the Dragons of Cathay before and come off worse, leading to more than a little trepidation about fighting them again.
The Ruinous Powers will be our undoing!
This one has seen the embers of the Chaos Dwarf forges and felt the ferocious weapons wielded by them.
One Ruinous Power may not have presented too much of a problem, but all of them at once? Never again if this one can help it.
Friends and relatives killed by the Druchii were first made to suffer for the amusement of their cruel, heartless captors.
The bearded ones have sworn this one's death!
The brutality of the Greenskins is to be rightly feared.
So aloof, so whiter-than-white. And That hair! They give me the willies! You can keep 'em!
There is a reason the Dark Gods are hell-bent on the destruction of man…
Though they walked away with their life, this one saw the terrible slaughter brought down by the Blood God's servants, and lost dear companions to the carnage.
Maybe it's the cold that makes the Kislevites so willing to show no quarter? This one doesn't know, but has no desire to repeat the experience.
The sweltering heat, suspiciously clammy skin, and the cold, blank stares that stretch off into eternity are just too much for some…
It took a year of baths and still the stench permeated this one's flesh. Facing Nurgle again will definitely be bottom of the to-do list from now on.
Having narrowly escaped becoming dinner after losing a fray with Ogres and being tied to a stake for "marinatin' porpoises", this one's dreams are troubled and fitful.
The chatter, the stench, the pox-ridden fur - all repel this one greatly. They cannot bear to be in the presence of Skaven.
To be lashed and lacerated by slavering Daemonettes afore an altar to the Dark Prince forever might be your idea of a good time, but such things fill this one with terror.
This one has seen the Tomb Kings strip a battlefield of the living like a plague of Undead locusts. One doesn't forget that sort of thing in a hurry.
As the very definition of a plain-thinking 'straight shooter', the lies, deception, plots, endless machinations, and abject madness of Tchar disturbs this one greatly.
Eternal life isn't so desirable when you look into it carefully... This one has the sense to cut and run when certain ships appear over the horizon.
You are right to fear the Undead, for they wish an Unliving hell on us all!
This one has seen comrades coldly sacrificed to the forest and the whims of its aloof guardians, and has vowed never to return.
Try not to imagine the horrors that might lurk in these waters, hiding in the blackest depths beneath the waves.
This one thinks port is found in a bottle and stern is just a word to describe their mother!
If the ship doesn't sink under this one's command, it will be nothing short of a miracle.
The enemy march. Surely our walls will keep them out?
Their whole garrison can see this one shaking as the enemy draw near.
Known to hide and whimper at even the thought of an oncoming attack.
Archers let loose your arrows! Strike them down before they reach our line!
Walls are strong. These defenders are stronger.
This one presents a shield of steel to the enemy and dares them to try and break it.
There is many a mystery still left to uncover, across the Old World and the New.
Point anywhere on a map and this one has likely seen and done all there is to do there.
This one is irreverent where others might show trepidation.
Courage can often separate the good from the truly great.
Fear is a foreign concept to this being.
Somewhere there's a reason why some things just fall through.
I'll get round to that… eventually.
Couldn't someone else do it? What if I pay them?
Why work hard when you can work a little? And why work at all when you can sleep?
If you want something done right, do it by yourself.
To need anyone but oneself is the path to weakness.
This one works alone… Approach at your own risk.
Take care not to fall to Chaos – once in its grip, it's impossible to break free.
War is the province of monsters and fools.
Surely we can come to some kind of agreement?
Peace is a beautiful concept, and an unattainable illusion.
To free an enemy is a fatal mistake. Better to free them of their head.
Stealing objects is good business. Stealing people is more lucrative still.
Good order should be at the heart of any regime.
A presence of great severity demands obedience.
My word is law and the law is final!
Brutality comes easily to this one. The rush of the kill is a powerful addiction indeed.
War is but a means to an end… the end of weakness and the beginning of glorious slaughter!
Death and destruction worship at their feet.
The heroes of legend know the value of mercy.
Say what you like about the Beastmen, but they never deviate from the plan. They are the most reliable of allies.
Watching them conduct their art of war is a joy to behold – it's almost like a dance. The shapeshifting is mightily impressive too, and really spooks the enemy.
Obviously, like all Daemonkind, there's ulterior motives at play, but also skills in battle that are virtually unmatched, and they're utterly devoted to the task at hand.
Sometimes a penchant for cruelty can be utilised for the greater good. Well, for mutual benefit anyway…
The Dawi are a staunch ally.
Bring them war and the Orcs will thank you.
Their ever-present aloofness aside, this one finds the Asur trustworthy allies when it comes down to it - as it frequently does.
Only by uniting the nations can mankind hope to thrive.
Yes, there's overkill, to say the least, and beheadings and egregious carnage, but also great, great honour and courage you'll not see anywhere else.
They might be a bit superior and a tad condescending, but they're good fighters if you're on the same side.
I like them - they've got a plan and are absolutely assured of it. The way I see it, you want to be on the winning side, no?
Call me strange, but I've never felt love like that before or since, even if I did end up feeling a little bit icky afterwards.
They're nothing if not consistent. You've got to be fleet of foot or end up in the cooking pot, of course, but that aside, what you see is what you get.
This being's liking for the dishonest, distrustful, double-dealing treachery of the Skaven speaks volumes about their own values.
Well, I can see things His way. A bit of what you fancy does no harm, don't you think?
Settra is… hard work, but ultimately a dependable ally, whilst things are going well at least.
You can't trust Him any further than you could throw Him, but He's a certainly a force to be reckoned with. Nice plumage as well.
The high seas, the adventure - the ever-present danger; it has a certain allure, no?
We all die eventually, better to bring the masters of death to the cause sooner rather than later.
It's not personal, you see? The forest is their only concern. I can understand that - it is very beautiful after all.
Oh… how many enemies did you say there are?
A rustling tree branch has been known to make this one jump.
A Night Goblin thrust into sunlight would quake less with fear than this one.
The spawning that brought Kroq-Gar into the world produced a handful of Saurus, each marked for greatness.
The Witch King long ago sought to take Ulthuan's crown, but the Flames of Asuryan left him twisted with hatred and horribly scarred.
I would be so grateful for your cooperation in this, my lord. I do so hate to be... disappointed.
Magnificent chariots, gifted to those who have impressed with their devotion, bravery and prowess in battle.
I have no time for these petty court intrigues. Do or do not, and be damned with you!
Take any trinkets you find. The dead will need them no longer.
Pillage and plunder are the just rewards of victory.
Kill them all! All that they had is ours for the taking!
When you can finally stand upright on deck without losing your lunch, you know you've acquired your sea-legs.
These walls seem impenetrable. Do we even have ladders that tall?
Even a small wooden fence could keep this one out.
See, those walls look pretty tall... and I have this fear of heights…
With some sturdy shovels and a good plan, this one has a knack for getting past enemy defences.
We could go over, or we could go under. Either way, those walls won't be a problem for long.
These fools think their walls will protect them. Soon they will learn how wrong they were.
You can never have too much Warpstone. No, really!
Light the blue touch-paper and stand well back No, further back than that!
It's always sensible to stay on the good side of your betters...
No-one dares question the one bearing their overlord's scent!
Taking an eye is the best way to ensure the loyalty of an underling.
Slaves are but the spoils of war…. and what profitable spoils they are.
This one's enemies beware, because there's no telling where they might be lying in wait.
What great revelations must lie in the movement of the stars?
Pious worship is a source of great comfort to many.
Idle hands are the ruin of success.
It's simple. You make from the land, and we take from it… and from you!
Charisma and charm are enough to rally anyone to the cause.
You might find this one stalking amidst the shadows for their prey… or you won't find them at all.
There's always a way through the dark, for those willing to find it.
News has a way of travelling fast, and news of adventure and daring exploits travels faster than most.
To meet a hero of such renown would be a splendorous occasion indeed.
Where true glory and myth combine, a legend is born.
Even the wildest beasts can be broken by force of will such as theirs.
For all their Celestial mysticism and martial might, the Dragons and their minions have been defeated such that they are unlikely to return to the fray any time soon.
Today, the blight of Chaos and corruption on our land has been washed clean!
Blinded by their industrial pursuits and twisted by the mania of Chaos – it was too late to see the blade in front of them coming.
Powerful they may well be, but Ruin's most faithful servants were utterly defeated this time. Expect them to return on another occasion, and stronger, however.
Cornered by using their own cruelty and malice against them, the Druchii quest for domination falters.
Another victory for the records. The Dwarfs have learned to fear this one.
Greenskin savages deserve no mercy but the sharp edge of a blade.
It's harder to maintain an air of condescension when another's blade is in your back.
Men are little more than base animals in sore need of culling.
They came to spill blood and take heads, but the Blood God's forces were served ignominious defeat instead. Khorne's revenge will be terrible when it comes, however.
Those arrogant Kislevites, who think themselves hardiest of all, have been sent packing back to their frozen waste of a kingdom – and at this one's hand, no less!
Being utterly vanquished doesn't seem like part of the Great Plan.
This day, the Urfather has been banished from reality. If you think that death and its stinking bedfellow, decay, can be eliminated for all time, though, then think again.
This master of strategy and tactics has wiped the crude, lumpen Ogres from the chessboard. If not forever, then temporarily at least.
Bandits, traitors and outlaws are all cravens to the end, running in fear of the day that justice comes to claim their heads.
These subterranean rat-creatures are naught but a vile pestilence we must eradicate.
By forcing the Dark Prince out, the world is… if not purer, then certainly a marginally less depraved place for it. He will return, however, and be all the stronger for it.
Glory and riches await those brave enough to dare walk their halls.
For now, at least, but only for now, mind, the world will remain the same as it was. The Great Conspirator shall never cease his ever-ruthless scheming, however.
